body_text.text: Title: Reply to "Varicella-like exanthem as a specific COVID-19-associated skin 2 manifestation: multicenter case series of 22 patients": To consider varicella-like 3 exanthem associated with COVID-19, virus varicella zoster and virus herpes simplex 4 must be ruled out. 5 Figures 1 and 2) . Finally, we agree with the idea of further studying this recently described varicella-like 57 exanthem in order to clarify how we can distinguish it from other dermatosis and use it 58 to identify otherwise asymptomatic patients to test them earlier. But even today, when it 59 seems that all of our patients are affected of COVID-19 and all the skin diseases may be 60 related to COVID-19, we must keep in mind that other dermatological diseases still 61 exist. That is why we think that when we face a patient presenting with a varicella-like 62 rash, we should perform Tzanck smear, virus culture, PCR on the vesicle fluid and/or 63 skin biopsy in order to rule out disseminated forms of other common viral infections.
